result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven M. Latterell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: This judgment is for fines, court costs and restitution that you were ordered to pay through Dept of Corrections - if not paid during probation - or you get revoked  and have not paid in full - you will be required to pay to the Clerk of Courts any unpaid amount plus interest.

supervisions.notes: 1 year probation conditions of probation    complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent, pay costs on both counts of $243.00 each count.  Report to probation today.

miscConds.notes: $243.00  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent

records.addlTxt: From DOC - Discharge from Probation  All costs and fines were paid while on probation - remove judgment.
of right to seek postconviction relief.

Defendant Steven M. Latterell in court with attorney Martin Jarvis.  John M Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts, state moves to amend CT#1 to Possession THC misd. court so orders, DEF pleads NC to amended CT#1 and CT#2, DEF found guilty,
Court withholds sentence on both counts, places DEF on 1 year probation conditions of probation    complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent, pay costs on both counts of $243.00 each count.  Report to probation today.

Defendant Steven M. Latterell in court.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Acknowledges receipt of complaint; waives reading of complaint; advised of rights/penalties; advised of right to prelim; wishes to contact counsel; put at foot of calendar for DE to speak w/PD. BOR 9:22 apearing with atty. Martin Jarvis today; waives time limits for prelim - reserves right; NGP by Court for misd.; bond set.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 11:00 am.
